DataElement.preferredName: Blood Specimen Molecular Analysis Complete Remission Assessment Most Recent Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the most recent date of an assessment of a blood specimen submitted for research purposes for complete remission, the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment, by molecular analysis, techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Specimen Molecular Analysis Complete Remission Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment of a blood specimen submitted for research purposes for complete remission, the disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment, by molecular analysis, techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).:The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the most recent date of an event, assessment, or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Nearest to the present time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Date of most recent periphera
ReferenceDocuments.description: Date of most recent peripheral blood specimen assessed for molecular complete remission
